Section.Heading: Introduction to XML
Section.Paragraph: This is an example of mixed content in XML where text and elements are intermixed within the same element. This is common in document-oriented formats like XHTML and DocBook.
Mixed content allows for rich text formatting within paragraphs, making it useful for documentation and publishing applications.

Section.Heading: Processing Challenges
Section.Paragraph: Mixed content can be challenging to process because you need to preserve both the text nodes and the element nodes in the correct order. Many XML processors are designed primarily for data-oriented XML rather than document-oriented XML.
